t: Proverbs 13
A*pn wise son heeds*i his father’s instruction, But*ld a scoffer does not listen to rebuke.
A*ln man shall eat well by the fruit of his*i mouth, But*ld the soul of the unfaithful feeds on violence.
He*ld who guards his mouth preserves his life, But*ild he who opens wide his lips shall have destruction.
The*ln soul of a lazy man*i desires, and has*i nothing; But*ld the soul of the diligent shall be made rich.
A*ln righteous man*i hates lying, But*ld a wicked man*i is loathsome and comes to shame.
Righteousness*ld guards him*i whose*i way is blameless, But*ld wickedness overthrows the sinner.
There*ln is one who makes himself rich, yet has*i nothing; And*ild one who makes himself poor, yet has*i great riches.
The*ln ransom of a man’s life is*i his riches, But*ld the poor does not hear rebuke.
The*ln light of the righteous rejoices, But*ld the lamp of the wicked will be put out.
By*ln pride comes nothing but strife, But*ld with the well-advised is*i wisdom.
Wealth*ln gained*i by*i dishonesty will be diminished, But*ld he who gathers by labor will increase.
Hope*ln deferred makes the heart sick, But*ld when*i the desire comes, it*i is*i a tree of life.
He*ln who despises the word will be destroyed, But*ld he who fears the commandment will be rewarded.
The*ln law of the wise is*i a fountain of life, To*ld turn one*i away from the snares of death.
Good*ln understanding gains favor, But*ld the way of the unfaithful is*i hard.
Every*ld prudent man*i acts with knowledge, But*ld a fool lays open his*i folly.
A*ln wicked messenger falls into trouble, But*ld a faithful ambassador brings*i health.
Poverty*ln and shame will*i come*i to him who disdains correction, But*ld he who regards a rebuke will be honored.
A*ln desire accomplished is sweet to the soul, But*ld it*i is*i an abomination to fools to depart from evil.
He*ln who walks with wise men*i will be wise, But*ld the companion of fools will be destroyed.
Evil*ln pursues sinners, But*ld to the righteous, good shall be repaid.
A*ln good man*i leaves an inheritance to his children’s children, But*ld the wealth of the sinner is stored up for the righteous.
Much*ln food is*i in*i the fallow ground*i of the poor, And*ld for lack of justice there is waste.
He*ln who spares his rod hates his son, But*ld he who loves him disciplines him promptly.
The*ln righteous eats to the satisfying of his soul, But*ld the stomach of the wicked shall be in want.
